medical_history.chief_complaint: Postoperative severe bronchospasm and hypotension triggered by exposure to a disinfectant spray.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began shortly after the exposure to the disinfectant spray, minutes after extubation, characterized by audible expiratory wheezing, increased inspiratory effort, arterial desaturation, and hypotension.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of mild urticarial reactions to penicillin, erythromycin, codeine, and aspirin. Over the last 6 months, she experienced recurrent episodes of dry cough, breathlessness, and chest tightness due to the use of a disinfectant compound at her workplace.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a nurse and had stopped smoking 4 years previously.
